captions.text:
Hi, I’m Jim, for Mercedes-Benz. I’m going
to show you how to use the COMAND touchpad
controller in your vehicle.

The COMAND controller works in conjunction
with the central screen in the dash.

It consists of both a rotary selector and
a touchpad.

Both of them operate some of the same functions
and selections in different ways… so you

can choose whichever one is easier for you.
In addition, a row of push buttons – or

hard keys – is arranged around the controller...
or on the dash.

These let you go directly to the main modes
of COMAND… like navigation, radio, audio

media, the phone, and vehicle settings.
You can move the rotary selector in several

directions, much like a computer mouse. You
can rotate it, you can slide it left, right,

up and down, and you can press it down to
select an item.

The touchpad works a lot like a tablet or
touchscreen phone. You can glide your finger

left, right, up and down to move about the
screen and its menus and lists. Just press
to select an item.
Using two fingers offers other functions:
Pinch in or out to zoom on a navigation map.

Twist your fingers, like you’re turning
a virtual knob, to adjust the volume or other
settings.

And slide up with two fingers to reveal a
quick-access menu for the audio or phone.

To put the menu away, slide two fingers down.
There are also three permanent touch-keys
along the base of the touchpad:

The BACK key, labeled with an arrow, takes
you back one screen or menu level… just
like the BACK button next to the rotary control.

The middle key brings up the quick-access
menu for the audio or phone. You can also

display this menu by swiping up with two fingers
at any time. Then, glide left or right with

one finger to select items… or swipe down
with one finger for a submenu of related functions.

And the star key brings up your favorite functions.
You can also set up, rename and change your

favorites by swiping down with one finger.
Or you can do this via the COMAND Vehicle

Settings menu.
To switch between the rotary and touchpad

controls, just tap down on whichever one you
want to use.

The main functions of COMAND are divided into
horizontal menus on the screen along the top…
and the bottom.

To jump to these menus, slide the controller
up… or down.

Or tap the touchpad and glide your finger
up or down to either menu.

There’s an additional menu at the bottom
for climate control functions.

To scroll through these main menus, either
rotate the knob… or slide it left or right.

Or, use the touchpad the same way, rotating
with two fingers, or swiping side-to-side

with one.
To select the highlighted item, press the
knob or touchpad. The submenu will appear.

Once again, you can scroll through with the
rotary control or the touchpad. Then, select

an item by pressing down.
To exit the current menu and return to the
previous screen, press the BACK button.

Hold the BACK button down to go directly to
the main screen for the current mode… for

example, the main audio screen.
The touchpad also recognizes handwriting,
making it easy to input letters and numbers…

You might do this to search in your phonebook…
to enter an address in the navigation system…

or for other functions.
To input text where you see the cursor on

the screen, just draw each letter or number
with your finger. You’ll quickly be able
to do this by feel alone.

As the system recognizes each letter, it will
sharpen on the screen and repeat it out loud,
so you can move on to the next letter.

If it’s not sure what letter you meant,
you’ll see a few suggestions on the right.
Just select the character you intended.

To delete a character, glide to the left.
And to write a space, glide in a line to the

right, like you’re drawing a long dash.
To move the cursor to another line on the

screen, tap the touchpad and a menu appears.
Select the “T” symbol for text… glide

up or down to your desired line… and tap
again so you can start writing there.

For more information… please see your COMAND
or “Audio 20” Operator’s Manual.

Remember, there’s also an on-screen Digital
Operator’s Manual in your COMAND system.

If you have further questions, your Mercedes-Benz
dealer will be happy to help. Thanks for watching.

title: How To: Touchpad -- Mercedes-Benz USA Owners Support
